text.div:
PH Case Status Codes

Codes identifying the stage lifecycle stage of the case

This code system http://fhir.hl7.org/us/case/CodeSystem/cr-status defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
in-progress In ProgressThis is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) case. Data may be incomplete or unverified.
suspended SuspendedIncomplete or unavailable because the case has been temporarily halted.
aborted AbortedIncomplete or unavailable because the case was abandoned prior to completion.
completed CompletedThe case is complete
reopened ReopenedSubsequent to being completed, the case has been reopened. This includes any change in the results, diagnosis, narrative text, or other content that has been issued.
entered-in-error Entered in ErrorThis electronic record of this event should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".)
unknown UnknownThe authoring system does not know which of the status values currently applies. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just not known which one.

name: PH Case Status Codes
description: Codes identifying the stage lifecycle stage of the case

concept.definition: This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) case. Data may be incomplete or unverified.
Incomplete or unavailable because the case has been temporarily halted.
Incomplete or unavailable because the case was abandoned prior to completion.
Subsequent to being completed, the case has been reopened. This includes any change in the results, diagnosis, narrative text, or other content that has been issued.

This electronic record of this event should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it.  (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".)

The authoring system does not know which of the status values currently applies.  Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just not known which one.
